Also, in my 16 year experience, someone who was serious about skin care and procedures would not mind paying the $100 consultation fee to come into the office to discuss these things like an adult.

name: Brannigan Keller
text:
Edited from a 1 star to a 5 star

My 2 year old child was a new patient and one of his siblings got sick the day of the appointment. I called to try to reschedule and was informed that I would be charged a no show fee. I do not think they could have made me pay the $50 no show fee as I had never been to this business before and more importantly was not aware of this ridiculous amount but called my spouse to make arrangements to go.  Needless to say they lost mine and my families business, I would not recommend them to anyone as my experience is not how to treat customers.

I’ve changed my negative review to a positive one after receiving a phone call from the owner of this practice.  It’s nice that he took the time to call and listen to my concerns while making attempts to set things right. I understand why these “no show” policies have to be in place as I work in the healthcare field as well.  After talking to the owner I would recommend this business.

resp.text: Ms. Keller, Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize that this was your experience. Charging for missed appointments due to illness is not and has never been our policy. Again, we apologize.

name: Doug Merkel
text: Always nice. Front desk back. We do not wait long to be seen. Good location for us.

name: Trina Janay
text: Saw Dr. Rayna Dyck(she was recommended by some people i know personally). & she was horrible. She first off camebin very dry which is a horrible first impression and my attitude immediately was based off of hers and by her attitude being so dry (seemed like she really didn’t want to be at work) it made me not believe anything she said or that she didn’t care to help ...although everything she said might have been true. Her staff though is very sweet. I didn’t get the medication she thought MIGHT help b/c it was pointless to purchase out of pocket if it MIGHT help. And the two reasons she said i might have skin discoloration was definitely not my case. I’m big on reviews & she had a few reviews on her dry attitude but i gave her the benefit of the doubt because i had people who recommended her..obviously b/c she helped their condition & not off her attitude. She was so awkward & dry. Def. appreciate Dr. Hartman for giving me a call about my visit and hopefully i dont have to pay another co-pay when i fu with him b/c today i def. paid a co-pay for no reason at all. and the stars are for the staff and him calling me back def. not for Dr. Dyck.

name: Gillian McCown
text:
Dr. Youhn had the nerve and audacity to tell me that I should wean my son. Last I checked, breastfeeding is outside her scope of practice and she has no business giving professional advice about childcare or breastfeeding to a patient. It is unethical to give advice or direction on any topic professionally outside one’s scope. Breastfeeding and the health and wellness of my son most definitely are.

Updated because they decided to be unprofessional with their response here and on Facebook.

These comments started when I was asked if he was my only one and if I was thinking about having more yet and I said I'm still not sleeping so no. She kept saying should really talk to his ped because he doesn't need to be nursing all night long. At his size he doesn't need to eat at night and he's probably just doing it out of comfort. I didn't ask for sleep advice.
I mean I could understand her saying the nursing could be irritating my issue and that weaning might be something to consider.
But talking about how my son doesn't need to nurse anymore and I should really just talk to his pediatrician about weaning him is way beyond her scope and none of her damn business!
His pediatrician has no problem with it and nursing till 2 is recommended by the WHO.

name: Gina Delbianco
text: The Chelsea office is aweful. I've been taking my daughter's here for skin care for a long time now...mostly because we live in Chelsea and it's convenient. I've decided I've had enough of their extremely snooty, unfriendly staff. We had been seeing Dr. Murphy in this office for years and then one day she just  magically dissapears and is replaced by a different dermatologist with no explanation. Nothing!  Can't stand this office!!  We wiill be moving on to a new dermatologist and hopefully a smiling, friendly and much more upbeat atmosphere!   Alert people! Five minutes after posting this review My phone rings and this man states is name is Dr. Hartman ..and demands to know my reasonings for posting this review! This is just too unreal for me! Skin wellness of Chelsea ...you are sketchy!!!!!!  Ok so now I'm getting harrassing messages from two different area codes regarding this review. I guess Skin wellness pays some crappy people to harrass people that give bad reviews in hopes they will erase it. Not going to happen. You're Chelsea office sucks!....Excuse me! Whoever you are..her name was Brittany and she treated my children's skin problems for years. And please . ..stop texting your profane messsges to my phone!

resp.text: We pride ourselves on being friendly and helpful. We have never employed a doctor named Murphy. Good luck achieving your skin care goals.

name: Sarah Holder
text: Fantastic staff and exceptional providers. The whole team goes above and beyond for their patients!

name: Lillian Byner
text: In response to Dr. Hartman's reply to my review, I appreciate your telephone call. However, as I communicated to you in our conversation last night which you neglected to include in your response, I have waited for a return call to my non-urgent issue way longer than 24-48 hours. My first follow-up appointment where the biopsy was taken was on June 13th, where I was told by a clinician that I would know the results before I left for vacation. I called for results initially 1 or 2 days before I left town June 23rd. I then called back on the 28th, where I was told once again that I would be called back before close of business, yet I was not. I was never informed by any of your staff that I spoke with (both clinical and non-clinical - I have spoken with both) of the 10-14 day timeframe for biopsy results. In speaking with you last night is the first I have heard of the 10-14 day waiting period for results and the results not being discussed until the scheduled follow-up visit. Perhaps some form of training refresher would be useful in ensuring that all of the staff, both clinical and non-clinical are relaying uniform information and setting the proper expectations to the patients. Once again, I appreciate your reaching out to me and I am sorry that I had a less than desirable experience.

name: N H
text: This was an incredibly poor experience with customer service.  I stopped in on a very slow Wednesday night as an out-of-towner, returning to New York the next morning.  There was an hour before closing and the salon was mostly empty.  I showed the girl my unpolished/natural nails (aka minimum prep required) and asked about a manicure.  She smirked at me and said they wouldn't see anyone else that evening, despite the sign on the door saying there was still an hour remaining and walk-ins were welcome.  I asked again, explaining that I was going to be flying out the next morning and she just smirked again and said they wouldn't see me and I could leave.  As I left, I noticed that they turned the 'Open' sign off.  I cannot believe this.  Hours posted exist for a reason, and this kind of poor experience in New York would shut a salon down very quickly.  I guess Alabama doesn't have enough high-quality competition, and can support this kind of nonsense from customer-supported dollars.

resp.text:
Hello, Ms. N H. Unfortunately, you came in after 6:30pm asking for double services. Our receptionist told you that all our nail technicians were already servicing the other customers and would not have gotten to you in time. Every night, we turn off our "open" at 6:30pm and you walked in after we had already turned it off. We try our best to take in everyone who walks in, especially if they come in "an hour" before we close.
I am sorry you feel that way and if you decide to give us another chance, please feel free and call to make appointment with us, to secure your spot on the book with us. We do prefer appointments because it gives us the crowd control and social distance between the customers. Thank You.

name: Johnathan Dennis
text: My first time and I can say I'd do it again! Very relaxing and professional! 👍🏽

name: Karmel Karma
text: I’ve recommended this place to several people.  They list their hours till 7pm.  But DO NOT go there after 5:30 pm.  This is the second time that they rejected customers between 5:30 and 6:15 when they weren’t even busy.  If you list your hours till 7, you plan on taking customers till 7.  Otherwise, put it in your ad that you don’t take customers after 5:30.  An out-of-town guest was dropped off there by a friend going thst way and I was to pick her up at 7 after feeding and bathing her two year old.  They wouldn’t take her  because they said it was too late.  She arrived at 6:05.  She’s now walking the two miles back.   I would never recommend these yo-yos again!

resp.text:
Hello Ms. Karmel, I am so sorry you feel that way about our hours. Our hours are from 9am-7pm, our cut off time(to stop taking in walk-ins) is at 6:30pm(with one service). We take both walk ins and appointments, but appointments are prefer due to crowd control and social distancing with our COVID-19 precautions. We will and do accept walk ins if we have available nail techs to start on you right away or with a 10-15mins wait gap.

Your friend walk in when all of our technicians were already working on their clients and would not have finished on time to start on your friend, she would have waited over an hour. Every night, we turn off our "open" sign at 6:30pm and your friend came in after we had already turned it off. If you decide to give us another chance, we recommend you calling and making an appointment first to guarantee you a spot with our nail technicians. Thank you.

What people need to understand is that they are student and they are trying their best, and as for comments made on Ms. Susan I think she is a lovely person, very sweet and very helpful. text: I communicated to the student EXACTLY what i wanted. I wanted an overall color change and had multiple pictures as examples. They do not listen to the client and often times listen to the head instructor even though it wasnt what i had even asked for. Very disappointed

text: Chelsea is amazing and certainly reflects the professionalism of the Paul Mitchell experience. So glad that I have had the opportunity to return especially in these restrictive pandemic times.

text: I always enjoy every experience I have had at Paul Mitchell! They are very professional and seem to stay on top of students. I wish I had time to go there more often. My last visit was great. I was trying something new with my hair color and wished I would of had time to go back during the grace period to have them go up higher with my color. Other than that everything was great. Do not go in when you are in a hurry. It is a school and they are learning so have to have patience. Thanks so much!

name: Lindsay Bogle Waits
text: I have been a faithful customer for 6 years, and I have been satisfied with my hair cut and highlight services. Unfortunately the past few times I have had highlights done, the learning leaders have not led the students well. Recently the student was unfamiliar with highlighting and caused the lightener to “bleed” causing an intense and distinctly different contrast to show up on the root and parted portion of hair. They tried to fix the problem by toning this portion. By toning the hair I no longer had highlights in this portion leaving the hair a reddish dark color on the root in contrast to the blond. They offered to provide additional highlights on another visit but I would still have to pay for the lightener. I was told $13. The next time I came within 7 days to have the lightener done to fix the toned area without highlights. It became apparent the learning leaders only add a small amount of lightener to each extra bowl needed to lighten so they can up charge $13 per bowl. I have noticed this in the past. This time I was charged for 3 bowls. The instructor said these extra bowls were not necessary, however the instructor allowed the student to use this amount. In addition to the bleeding mistake that occurred the previous time without proper supervision, I was disappointed by the poor customer service given by the instructors and poor business strategy taken by charging the customer for a mistake that was done under the lack of care by the learning leader. I have recommended this school in the past, but I will no longer do so. I am disappointed in the lack of desire to serve the customer well and the lack of instruction done by the instructors.

name: Ashley Linden
text:
I am so pleased with my first experience of Paul Mitchell. My stylist was Shelby, and she did a great job of listening to what I asked for. I was very pleased with how her instructor payed attention to her work and helped where needed and did an excellent job. I wish I had gotten her name.

I brought pictures and was very specific about wanting layers and they talked out ideas and were willing to give advice and do whatever I wanted. I never felt rushed (even though my hair was super long and it took an hour and a half) or like I was inconveniencing anyone even when I asked them to go back and put some more layers in.
Other salons had argued with me about layers in the past and seemed afraid to cut my long hair and I have left disappointed, but not here! Thank you all for a fun and relaxed environment with great prices too!

name: S s
text: Went for a haircut recently and had a very good experience. Robert (instructor) did my haircut and he is an excellent teacher. I was here couple of times in past too and never had any bad experience with students. Instructors are always taking care of each client. Thank you Paul Mitchel instructors for all the effort you guys put in to teaching the art to the students. It’s very important to know what you want to get done and explain it to your stylist. Cost is unbeatable. It’s gonna be a while for them to work on you, they are learning on you so help them. Show pictures so they can get a better understanding of what you want.

name: Amy Floyd
text: This was my first time, and it was an okay experience. It took a long time for a wash & cut (75 minutes), but that is to be expected as it is a teaching school. I ended up fixing my own hair once I got home because there were lots of uneven places. If you are broke & can't afford to go somewhere else, this is a good choice. You just may have to repair your hair a bit on your own afterwards.

resp.text: Hey there Amy! We appreciate your honest feedback and you're absolutely right-we are a school! Our students are all at different levels of skill based on several factors including, but not limited to, length of time they have been in the program and the specific areas in which they excel. You may not have known this, but we have a 100% guarantee and you can always let us address any issues you might have had with your service. Students work on guests because they need the hands-on experience which is part of their curriculum. Students aren't ready for the salon until they have completed their program, hours, and have taken both their written and state board exams. They are then ready to transition to an actual salon. We also have students who are in a program here we call Phase 2. These students must pass an interview and hands-on assessment in makeup, cutting, color and texture. These "master level" students are available upon request and you'll be getting a more advanced, driven student that is much further along in their program. However, these services do cost a bit more. All that being said, we have to remember that we are a school, first and foremost. We love being able to offer extremely low (much lower than an actual salon) prices for our guests because our students need the hands-on experience. We can all remember the first time we tried to accomplish something...sometimes it was great, but sometimes we also had a lot to learn from the experience. But with practice and patience, we got so much better than when we started and that's exactly how it is for our students. We hate that you weren't happy with your hair, but we do appreciate the time you gave our student in letting them perfect their craft.

name: Alyssa ellis
text: As a student, I’d like to personally say, in regards to all of our learning leaders they help us to the best of their ability and in regards to them caring, they care way more than most normal teachers or instructors and ALWAYS try to make sure the guest is happy, although sometimes it can be confusing on what is trying to be communicated - Our learning leaders are the best there are is assisting us in our journey.

name: jessalyn jones
text: TERRIBLE SCHOOL!!!!!! No one helps the students out. They have to many people on the floor at once it looks crazy. I went in for a cut and it took 2 and a half hours.. because “Susan” wouldn’t help the student. If I could give a zero star I would. AWFUL!

name: Kaitlyn Marlowe
text:
The first time I went my experience exceeded expectations.

I have been twice more it service has been terrible.

(1) I was told 2 hours and approximately $40 for a basic cut and color. SIX hours later I was still there and the bill was $110 because the student colored my hair in a way we had not discussed during the consultation.

(2) I had to bring my child with me to an appointment and was refused service.  Which is fine.  Inconvenient, but fine.  However, the attitude behind the refusal was quite rude.

I instead went for a hair cut which was great for the price and the job my stylist did was wonderful. Highly recommend.

name: Diane Harris
text:
I had been using the location in Madison, AL for several years, then moved back to the Montgomery area last year.  Birmingham is the closest location to me, so I tried a local cosmetology school.  They do not measure up to Paul Mitchell.  I decided to make the drive to Birmingham and was certainly not disappointed.

I received the service I  have come to expect from Paul Mitchell schools.  I was asked questions to determine my wants and needs and an instructor was checking in throughout to assure the work was being done to my satisfaction.  I have my next appointment scheduled and am bringing a couple of friends, as well.

resp.text: Ms. Harris we are so pleased to hear about your wonderful experience here and can’t wait to see you again for your next service!

name: Alyse Gilliam
text: Had a great time here! We went in to get my hair, makeup and manicure done for junior prom. Everyone was super friendly and easy to talk to. Even though I got there a few minutes late we had no wait time at all. Taylor was so sweet and helpful, talked to me about exactly what I wanted done and just made the whole thing stress free. I went with a black manicure, curly side updo and soft makeup with a red lip. Everything turned out perfect and stayed from my morning appointment to after prom! I am definitely going back and would advise anyone who has a special occasion coming up or just wants to treat themselves to check The School out! It is also very very reasonably priced :)

name: Kim Nguyen
text: Had a great first-time experience at Paul Mitchell The School Birmingham.   Hannah gave me a cut & style and fixed my poor attempt at a trim from a few days ago (I had completely butchered my bangs). Everyone here is very friendly and welcoming. I love my hair and my bangs now and will definitely be coming back!

name: Julie Hughes
text: My daughter, Katie, graduated from Paul Mitchell today. Thanks to the staff for their guidance and expertise.  The instructors, staff and owners taught her, not only how to be a hairstylist, but the business aspect of the profession. Now she has the foundation she needs to go out into the world. Without a doubt, she will be successful! Thank you!

resp.text: Julie thank you so much for the kind words! It was so wonderful having Katie enrolled at our school. She is such a kind and creative individual and we’re truly going to miss her. We wish her all the best in this next chapter of her life!

name: Tamara Morton
text: The receptionist and my beauty specialist were very professional. My pedicurist tried her very best to do a good job and she did. I was very pleased with the outcome. What a treat! Regarding your website, I would like to be able to see prices for all the services that you provide. I'd probably end up spending money on more procedures if I could see what options were available. Anyways, I just discovered you, I've had two excellent experiences and I'm very happy to be a new client. I'll certainly spread the word to my friends.

name: Jennifer R James
text: Great place if you’re willing to help others learn/allow them to practice on you. Love the staff & the students. I always leave happy.

name: Monika Camino
text: Students do not seem to know what they are doing. And they seem to not have a lot of help. The student sat and waited for a teacher to come by and help for over 15 minutes while I sat there and watched the black teacher mess around with the black students. So unfair... need better staff!

name: Nikita Monroe
text: I will never go back! Teachers are so rude. Small white lady with blonde hair made me feel so unwelcomed and treated the student as if she was dumb for not knowing what to do. Not yet fault this school doesn’t teach the students.

name: Nancy Ledbetter
text: Love going there! My sister's and I meet there once a month for girls day. The students are always eager to please and the instructors are very helpful and ready to jump in if necessary.

name: Anna-Marie Settine
text: I love to come here to get my haircut. They always do a great job, and all of the products make my hair feel and smell amazing. The students and leaders are all very nice, professional, and talented. They listen to exactly what you want and make sure you leave with beautiful hair!

name: Cathy Forrest
text: Loved my haircut today.  People are so nice. The owner came over and helped, very great teacher.  I highly recommend that you try it out!!

name: Holly Parker
text: I have been in the past and had good experiences but sadly I can no longer say that. I went a few weeks ago and they seemed really rushed and not as personal as in the past. The instructor didn’t check my hair when I was completely done. After about a week I noticed that my hair was uneven and a huge chunk was shorter. I called to see if they could fix it and was told it had to be within 7 days and I would have to pay for a new cut. I was unable to go in any sooner because it snowed and then I had to work the weekend at my job.  I would gladly have given them a chance to fix it but they haven’t taken any action towards making it right. I am saddened by the fact that they messed my hair up and won’t fix it for the integrity of their establishment. I left a message for the manager and have not gotten a response back. This happened about a month ago. In my book, that’s a sign of being unprofessional. I will not be going back here.I hope they can fix this and do better in the future!

name: shawn swartz
text: I love coming here. They give such individual attention, more than I've ever received in a private salon. My hair is extremely thick and quirky and they spend the time asking questions and learning my hair before ever starting. The instructors remember me and my hair every time I come in. I won't go anywhere else to get my hair done.

name: Brenna Terry
text: Professional and fun! I have gone in and asked for a variety of edgy, complicated styles- bob, pixies-  and have yet to be disappointed. Even if the student is still learning the ropes, the stylist who oversees them will make sure that they give you a great 'do. Sometimes you may have to wait a bit for the head stylist to approve, offer advice, etc. but the wait is worth it in the end. Please support PM and help these up-and-coming stylists start their careers!

name: Tamara Caffee vlogs
text: I got my hair dyed here amd i cant get over how good it looks i did natural colors and it looks great i recommend this place

name: Stephanie Pilgrim Moore
text: Very friendly and professional, the only downside was that it took about an an hour and forty five minutes for a shampoo cut and blow dry (which normally took less than an hour at other salons).  However, I was happy with the service and the results.  Have already booked my next appointment.

name: brenda Weaver
text: Tori R.  Dyed my hair and it turned out fabulous!   Not only did I get great results,  but expertise customer service!   Everyone was there to help her with the foiling of my hair, which took a long time.  But she did an excellent job and I am so pleased with the results.  I will recommend Paul Mitchell Academy to everyone I know.  Thank you so much Tori!

name: Megan Richey
text: Salon experience for a great price! Their color is amazing and I always get a great cut. Actually, I have had better cuts by the students here than stylists at most expensive salons. Give it a try.

name: Patsy Blakley
text: I lost my hairdresser, he retired so I decided to try the school. I was really impressed and pleased with my experience. I got my hair cut and it was great and I liked the products they used on my hair. It made it soft and took care of the frizz. I will go back.

name: Wynter Rudolph
text: I had a wonderful experience at Paul Mitchell.  The hairstylist were very friendly to me and I just love how my hair looks now. Robin Rudolph did an amazing job on my Eyebrow wax.  I love it!

name: Bonnie Ferguson
text: Adding this to my list of the WORST customer service in Birmingham. I didn't even get to step in the door because they CLOSED the school without letting anyone know! I drove all the way there in the RAIN for nothing! You need to let your customers know if their appointments are canceled! SO SO SO UNPROFESSIONAL. I don't even want to make another appointment if this is how they treat their customers. I wish I could give zero stars.

name: Astoria Riggans
text: Love it here

name: Azziza S
text:
My daughter, my mother and I all got great cuts. I've never had a color but I've decided to do it.

Sadly the student who had great talent graduated. The last time I went the student destroyed my hair, gave me scalp burns from a too strong bleach solution, and turned my blonde hair GREY.

Then the instructor absolutely refused to fix it. They were extremely rude and unprofessional. I will not be going back. Use the Aveda salon and school instead.

name: C Gilbert
text: Teairh is awesome. Done great with my hair and will go back to see her!

name: Carole Tull
text: I have been coming to the Paul MItchell School Birmingham for about five years, and I have never had a bad experience.  I love watching the new students become professionals, and I usually follow one student until he or she graduates.  I have made many friends, and I still hear from some of the people who did my cuts and color throughout the years.  Keep up the good work, Paul Mitchell students.

name: Allison Kerner
text:
I am very pleased with the hair trim I received!
Haley P. did it!  I will be back in a few months for another trim.  And thanks for allowing my hair to stay long...

name: Kat Henderson
text: I've gone three times now. They are very professional and definitely get the job done, I'm just disappointed in the time expectation. It took two hours my first time for hair bleach- I was going to get a cut but passed as I was on lunch and had spent too much time. They're not open Saturdays. 2nd time was cut bleach and toner, which was fine. Third time took almost 4 hours from the time I got there to the time they checked me out just to do root colour + toner. They put two hours on my chart. I'm not sure why the time it took doubled.

name: Nameless Faceless
text: Loved my highlights! Great prices and knowledgeable staff! Very professional.

name: Khrystal Fairchilds
text: I got my hair done there & love it.

name: Katharine Blackwell
text: I routinely get my hair cut at the Paul Mitchell School in Birmingham. They always do a great job, and I feel like I'm treated like a VIP client!

name: Catherine Glenn
text: I have always had an awesome experience here!  The stylists do a great job, and the price is right!

name: Shannen Wright
text: Been coming here 4-5 years had good experience and have seen many different girls only had one bad hair cut. But over all satisfied.

name: Taylor Lee
text: Worst service ever. Teachers are terrible. A student had no help she waited around for 15 minutes trying to get a teacher to help her. They need changes.

name: Mary Linda Smith
text:
Absolutely wonderful!!!
Great experience!!!   I've already made my next appointment!!!

name: Kylie Heitman
text: Really great experience!

name: K K
text: Proud graduate of 2015!!!

name: Rece Stewart
text: Love my haircut.

name: Mary Null
text: Jordan was my hair stylist a very nice, funny, friendly, and respectful worker. He did a very awesome job to my hair. LOVE IT.

name: amanda jones
text: Rick is the absolute best BAR NONE in Montgomery! Your airbrush spray  tan will look great and not look fake! He is very knowledgeable  and his friendly outgoing personality  will automatically  make you feel at ease and I promise you will  leave feeling like you have known  him forever!

name: Randy Montz
text: Always great to be here! Best staff and owners. Rick, Amy and the rest of the crew are always smiling and ready to serve!

name: Amy Knudsen
text: Olivia's has fabulous services such as nails, pedicures, massage, hair cuts & color with specialty services. You will not find a nicer more professional salon.  Their training & knowledge is superior & hard to find.

name: Madison Musgrave
text: First time going to this place and it is absolutely great! The staff is amazing. Jordin did such a great job on my hair. I would definitely give this place a 10/10.

resp.text: Thank you! So glad you came to see us.

name: alabama hashdog
text: Awesome spot for a massage, my wife and I did a couples massage and really got great service, and the staff are real friendly folks.

name: Cortney Powell
text: My stylist, Beth, was amazing and fit me in last minute.

name: Nicole Griffin
text: Love this salon!

name: Shellee Smith
text: Politeness, Cleanisess, Customer service, just delightful! Rick does amazing nails, Jordin does  amazing hair! LOVE those guys

name: Victoria Pope
text: Jordin is amazing. Very talented and makes it a fun experience!

name: Cat Honeycutt
text:
I got a same-day appointment in from out of town. The facility seemed like there was a lot of DIY work for upkeep - thick paint on cabinet doors so you could see the brush strokes, tiles with messy grout that looked dirty (and probably would no matter how you scrubbed), several different flooring styles as you walked through, visible command hooks used for hanging pictures. Finer finishes that made the salon look like it needed attention.

The haircut however was great. We had a consult where my stylist Tammy asked about my preferences, lifestyle, and schedule to make sure she could suggest appropriate styles that would look good at home. She was careful and thorough, and friendly but not overly talkative.

I will say, the services tab on google is not accurate for pricing, as a cut and style was more than listed on here. Still, it was a good service and I am satisfied with my results.

name: C Burgess
text: Heather is fabulous

name: Abigail Hipps
text: Jordin is amazing! I recommend him to everyone. I have a great experience every time.

name: Kay Adams
text: Jordan is always professional and does the best job with our hair.  He has us looking great and on our way quickly!

name: Carolyn Beck
text: Great hair color and a great cut! What more could I want!

name: Allison Jenkins
text: Awesome masseuse, with massage personalized and delivered just where you need it. Thank you Amy!

name: Marilyn Wright
text: Heather at Olivia's can work magic with your hair and make you feel special!

name: Mo Du
text:
Be ready for a lengthy review:
I was looking for a nail salon to become my regular spot.  Unfortunately, Olivia A. Salon is not the place for me.  I went in for an acrylic fill with gel on top and while everyone was friendly  I left unhappy with my nails.   The result was chunky, overly thick, and uneven.  It looked worse than press on nails glued and painted by a child.  The nail technician did NOT use a drimmel or motorized file but used a foam hand file to take off my existing and layer of acrylic.
At first this seemed nice but I was mistaken.  She was unable to file the smaller sectional of my nail bed and ended up filing skin which hurt.  My nails were embarrassing to look at as they appeared malformed and lumpy.  When she applied the gel she used 3 very thick coats of color that didn't dry under the light and were soft to the touch.  To be fair, I'm picky with my nails and when I saw the manicure going south I didn't say anything.  I should have.  Instead I left and went straight to another nail salon.  At the next salon they showed my Quasi-Modo nails around and laughed.
The salon itself is easy enough to find but the level of aesthetics is less than what I like.  They clearly want to be a high end salon but the quality is not quite there.  In addition, the prices were NOT worth it!  They charged $10 over what any other salon does.  The people were nice and they fit me in.  And I want to make it clear, I did not say anything to the lady.  But I'm not sure that she would have been able to fix them even if I had.

name: Kamaile Long
text: Went in for a haircut with Tammy and she did a great job. Very friendly and gave me the cut and style I wanted. Love it!

name: Devin Mendoza
text: Jordin Putnam is the absolute best , my faded hair style looked amazing for my quarterly  meeting in the Capitol .

name: Angela B
text: Had a very good hairdresser. Great job on my hair!

name: Amanda Taylor
text: Nicole gives the best hair cuts and is excellent with highlights. I highly recommend her!

name: Crystal Johnson
text: It looks cute on the outside and even in the front reception area but the rest of the place isn't well kept. I was receiving highlights and the cape the hairdresser put on me was filthy. I kept getting someone's cut hair on me and she hadn't started my hair yet. She was professional and very nice though. I only did a partial highlight and a trim which looked good blown out in her mirror. Then I got to my car and noticed that part of my eyebrow was bleached! She didn't use foils but some kind of paper and apparently when it was sitting on the front of my face it bleached through. Then the shampoo bowl had someone else's hair color left on the neck part of the bowl. Now that I have my hair pulled back I have parts that look like cheetah spots. I spent $150 for this! I will not go back or recommend this place to anyone.

name: Pam Lowe
text: I love Heather, she is talented and professional. I always walk out feeling beautiful.

name: Kelly Porter
text: Nice staff.  Great color and cut.  Ask for Tammie Bacon.

name: Rose Pendleton
text: Awesome and my hair is so smooth

name: Whitney Boutwell
text: Love jordan..he does a great job

name: Kim Hammonds
text: Love Heather she is the best so sweet

name: Mohamed Morshdy
text: Very bad service

name: mooon Alharbi
text: Great food

name: Lorelei Hobbie
text: Great

name: chandra mohan
text: Friendly staff

name: Angie Boatwright
text: Loved my experience here.😍 Ms. Lisa was the best! She noticed I was very nervous and did a great job easing my jitters. She talked to me through the whole process & it made the time go by so much quicker. I left with a little pep in my step.😊 Fast, friendly, & professional service 10/10 would recommend this place to anyone! Thank you Ms. Lisa.❤️

name: anna rose mabile
text: lauren is so professional and made me feel comfortable. 11/10 highly recommend! best sugaring i have ever had :)

resp.text: Thank you so much Anna for taking the time to leave such a great review!!

name: Sydney Smallwood
text: Amazing service. Lauren is the best. Been going to her for years.

name: Adrienne Barringer
text: Amazing experience and very friendly!

name: Natajah Amos
text: Used to go here all of the time but Lauren stopped being reliable. Whenever I tried to set appointments she would take over a week (or just stopped responding) to get back to me. For the years I went here, I thought it was crazy to just stop servicing me. But I plan on going to a new place and hopefully everything goes well. As for personality, Lauren was very sweet and made sure things went smoothly.

name: Jenn Anderson
text: Lauren was so personable, amazing, and accommodating! I had been looking for a new waxing place since we moved here a year ago and I'm so sad it took me this long to find this place! It was my first time sugar waxing and I loved it! For sure I will be a forever customer!

name: Jess Ask
text: Today was my first brizillian wax and I couldn’t have picked a better place. I booked Lauren and she could tell how nervous I was. She was so patient with me and encouraged me through the entire process. I was so insecure when we first started, but her kindness made me comfortable by the minute! I HIGHLY recommend this facility and I WILL be seeing Lauren in 4-6 weeks!

name: Tairian Nelson
text: Ellen is phenomenal! I started sugaring six (6) years ago only with Ellen. Never waxed before only sugared. I love it! Unfortunately, I moved to Michigan four (4) years ago and I only want to sugar. I found esthetician’s in Columbus OH, Birmingham MI, and Ann Arbor MI. No one is as amazing as Ellen. When I return home throughout the year to Montgomery AL, I book an appointment with Ellen. Ellen is the best ever!

name: Katie Jo Gossett
text: Very nice and well priced products

name: Crescent Licci
text:
IF YOU'RE LOOKING FOR A PLACE TO GET A WAX, LOOK NO FURTHER!!
I been going to Ellen for 2 years now, She is a wonderful person and does an amazing job. I would definitely recommend her.  She also has a number to text and a website if you want to make an appointment and responds quickly!

name: Shay
text: I was nervous at first, being that I am a Black woman and a plus size woman. However, when I walked in, Ms. Ellen made me feel so comfortable! She so kind and professional. Lauren is great, too! These are my go-to girls for all my sugaring needs. Lauren saved my life with a last minute service. They're great people and I wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: Cindy Howard
text: Jennifer Lambert is amazing! She was very helpful, professional, and did a fabulous job! I love the way my eyelashes look now, they went from barely there to luscious, I never want to be without extensions again. I would give her more than five stars if that was an option. LOVED HER!

name: Vernon Blake
text:
Love your new office!

Easy to find and access, plenty of free parking, nice waiting room, and very clean bathroom. Treatment room is clean, uncluttered, organized, private, and comfortable.

For anyone feeling a bit uncomfortable about any of the procedures or her facility, Ellen is very professional, has an excellent bedside manner, and will put your mind at ease.

Her expertise, experience, and passion for what she does is second-to-none!

resp.text: Thanks Vernon!! Everyone Loves my new location! Thanks you for your referral too!

name: Shelley Belly
text:
Thanks for the great Body Sugaring job you did, Ellen. I was a little nervous getting it ALL done but you really made me feel comfortable & I didn't feel nervous or embarrassed!  You are SO easy to talk to. Thanks for answering my million questions about hair removal. ;-).

PS:  your rooms are magnificent!  I felt like I was in a luxury spa (& I've been to a few!). I'll see you again soon. I have already recommended you to all my friends.

Thanks again - so much!

resp.text:
Hello Shelley!

Thank you for taking the time to visit my Google+ page and to leave this wonderful review.

I really enjoyed chatting with you - you were a lot of fun - and I appreciated all the questions you asked.

Intimate hair removal can be daunting for some, I know, so I'm glad that I put you at ease and that you felt comfortable, and are returning to continue with the process of hair removal.

I decorated my rooms myself, so thank you for the compliment!  I, like you, place hygiene and sanitation and cleanliness at the top of my list in my business.

I look forward to seeing you again soon.

Regards
Ellen

name: Lana Grier
text: I was c onfused regarding the various types of professional hair removal techniques. Ellen explained the differences between Electrolysis and Laser hair removal, as well as the advantages of Sugaring over traditional waxing. She was knowledgeable, friendly and patient, answering all of my questions so I could make an informed decision. Very much appreciated!

resp.text: Hi Lana, thank you for the kind review! I never get tired of discussing hair removal techniques. An educated client makes the best customer... it's a win-win! You're not alone regarding your confusion about electrolysis and laser hair removal treatments. I think most people are unaware they are two entirely different technologies, and one is MUCH better than the other... and yes... ELECTROLYSIS is the winner!!!

name: Taneshia Phomsavanh
text: Went here before and recieved amazing service.  Recently tried to book appt. And no one answered or called me back.  Maybe she went out of business.  Idk.

name: Taylor Reece
text: Thanks Ellen for the electrolysis you did on my neck and face. I highly recommend you to anyone. Love not having to shave my 5 o'clock shading constantly and no more razor burn.

resp.text:
Thank you, Taylor, for giving us the opportunity to assist you.  As you know, Electrolysis is the only FDA approved method of Permanent Hair Removal, and we thrilled that you're so pleased with the results.  Thank you, also, for taking the time to share your experience with others so that they too may benefit from professional hair removal.

Hide that razor!  :-)

name: Kimberly Holley
text: I can't rave enough about Lauren!  Super friendly...and super attentive!  I called last minute and she was able to work with my schedule -  although I am not a fan of the "pay by time"...because some people legs are longer than others...whenever I am in town I WILL ALWAYS run to Lauren!  BTW: Ellen is amazing too for electrolysis and sugaring for WOC! Dont say I didn't tell you...

name: Ginger Gams
text: This is the sugarwaxing Queen. I love Ellen. My husband calls her my Sugarmomma.

name: Lynn Daley
text: ""I thoroughly enjoy your hair removal articles about body sugaring and electrolysis. Also, I am now able to make an informed decision when choosing a permanent hair removal method. I look forward to visiting your new salon in Montgomery!"

resp.text:
Hi Lynn

I appreciate that you are visiting my Google+ page and reading my articles.  It's important to understand the types of hair removal methods offered and what they entail.

I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Ellen Dutton

name: Ellen D
text:
Thanks Vernon!!  Everyone Loves my new location!
Thanks you for your referral too!

resp.text: Hi Vernon, Thanks again for sending business our way... we're always happy to receive new clients and make new friends. I've been providing hair removal services in Montgomery for over 10 years now and it never gets old... :-)

name: Tricia Curry
text: Jessica is awesome. She made me feel so toally comfortable in what could have been a awkward situation.

name: Ayana Bell
text: No one answers the phone, I couldn’t even set up an appointment, went to their location and no one answered the door.

name: Destiny Caldwell
text: Great service.

name: Rebecca Brown
text: Called 4 times and left a message once. No one answered and no one called back. Gave them over a week to return my voice mail and nothing.

name: Sara Beasley
text: Lauren was awesome!!

name: Chris Day
text: Had my first massage here this weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommend this location.

name: Dennis Faul
text: Exceptional massage

name: Krystin Gentry
text: Cassi is very helpful and Dr. Saxena is great also!

name: Jennifer Smith
text: Massage therapist upset me. I called and asked for information on a muscle, specifically stated that I didn't want a massage, and she said she couldn't help me and to see a doctor. I only wanted to know specifically what was ailing me, but she wouldn't even look at it.

name: Randall Gober
text: Yard looks fantastic

name: P Sayasane
text:
I’ve attempted to schedule a four serenity package given to my daughters and I for Christmas. When I called to schedule earlier this year, I was told I would get a call back once they’ve contacted another masseuse to come in that they would need two and they would contact me back. I informed them if they was unable to schedule the four, I would like to schedule at least two. I never received a call back. I contacted them once again to schedule the four packages by leaving a message on the website and by phone on several different occasion. Once I received a response, I was informed they would have someone call me back and nothing. Left a message on the website and phone once again, Response…they didn’t have a masseuse in but once the masseuse returned or another one staffed I would be priority and we would be scheduled. I gave it 2 weeks and nothing. Left a message on the website again and by phone. Response, they would have to call me back when the new owners or previous owner was in.😱😳
With the COVID and lack of staff the owner (which will now be the previous) was kind enough to honor the now expired packages but to this day still haven’t been able to schedule an appointment.

I informed the person that gave us these gift certificates and it’s a disappointment thinking you’ve selected the best and get this type of response, unable to receive the services paid for.

Lesson learned: Gift certificates is NOT a good choice!

name: April Crysel
text: We had a wonderful afternoon at Bliss! They accommodated us as a group and fit us into the schedule perfectly. We all wanted something different ....massages, facials, and pedicures! The services were all great and everyone was very polite & professional. It was a great experience for my sister’s birthday!

resp.text:
Thank you so much.  I appreciate your review.  Being a business owner yourself, I know you understand just how much a 5 star review means.  I hope you guys have a great night.  I look forward to seeing you again!
Tera Shade

name: Caitlin Beakes
text: This spa is amazing! Friendly staff, incredibly hygienic, and every amenity you could ever need. The staff was very knowledgeable and professional. I had an incredible experience there and it is by far the best spot I have been to in Mobile.

resp.text: Thank you Caitlin for the 5 star review.  We all appreciate your taking the time to say such nice things about Bliss.  We hope to see you soon.  Teran Shade

name: J P
text: 5/13/21 Horrible! Appt set for my wedding 2 months ago for my mom and I to have our nails done together. Walked in at 3:30 and left and 9:00 with these nails and never had the spray tan that was suppose to happen after nail apptl $200 plus dollars for this disaster!!! Had to have nails redone next day before wedding.

name: Sharon Baugus
text: Wow! What a great spa! We took my Mom here while we were in town and she had the most wonderful experience! She had the body polish to remove dry areas and a foot peel.  Her feet are amazing now! She will definitely be back when we are in town!  Thanks for treating her special and doing such a great job!!

resp.text: Hi Sharon, Thanks for taking the time to leave a review.  We really enjoyed you and your mother.  We look forward to seeing you both again soon.  Your mother was a real treat!!!

name: Ash Ley
text: Hair dresser that was there messed my hair up beyond belief. I asked for one color and it is another color. Nail tech cut my hand doing my nails. Whole spa package felt like I was either waiting or being rushed into another room.

name: Shirita Williams
text: The best spa place in mobile ariel james did my massage and OMG it was amazing the whole staff is amazing the atmosphere is relaxing and everyone caters to u this place is amazing

resp.text: Shirita Thank you! Always nice to hear when someone is pleased with the attention they get while visiting Bliss.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Tera Shade

name: Cg Gaming
text:
Amazing and accommodating staff! They hosted four of us at one time and it truly was Pure Bliss!
We are already planning our next road trip to Mobile, just to visit Bliss Salon & Spa! The owner is so nice and her staff was wonderful! From massages, mani/pedi, mud wrap, facial, and hair, everything was perfect!

resp.text: Thanks for the review.  We had a good time pampering all of you.  From what you told us it sounds like you had a nice evening planned after you left Bliss.  Hope its not another year before we see you again!  Tera

name: Wanda Saunier
text: Dear Owner, You must not have a very good database. I was there, I spent over $300 for a haircut,  color, & upper last partial fills, I was there for over 7 hours.

resp.text: Wanda, Your name is not is our database. We have kept a database since the day we opened.  There is another company in town with the name Bliss.  I think you must have us confused with this other place. We would love to have you visit us so we have the opportunity  to show you who we are and how we take care of all of our clients.  Please drop by anytime.  Tera Shade

name: Denese Denson
text: I had a professional and pain free Brazilian wax done by Tera. I look  forward to going back.

resp.text: Thanks.  Have a good weekend at the beach!  See you soon, Tera

name: Rachel O'Brien
text: Great deep tissue massage with Tera Braxton today!  Even with the deep tissue work it was also very relaxing.  I feel like a new person!

resp.text: We agree, Tera is great!  We look forward to seeing you in the future.  Thanks for the review!

name: Kathy Morey
text: Wonderful Swedish massage by Tera. I came home so relaxed and feeling refreshed. Definitely need to do this again!

name: Tera Shade
text: In response to the "1 star" review written 3 years ago.  I responded 2 days after it posted but it never showed up, so I'll try again with my response...When this review was first posted the person included her name (it has since been changed to "anonymous").  I called the reviewer and inquired about her time spent at Bliss.  You see, I am the owner and very concerned about our reputation and our guests experience.  I believe the following information will help you decided if you want to take this reviewer seriously.   Let me begin by saying this reviewer called late in the day to make an appointment to have her hair cut.  Even though we were booked until closing time, one of my stylist agreed to stay late and take the appointment.  The two employees behind the desk greeted this reviewer, offered her something to drink, and informed the stylist of her arrival.  Because it was now after closing time, the two front desk employees left for the day.  This reviewer was not left alone or ignored at any time.  The stylist who volunteered to stay late, finished with the client she was with and was on time for this reviewers scheduled appointment.  This reviewer had her hair shampooed, had more of a trim than a cut, and blown out.  She was charged $15.  Her comment about being charged three times what she should have been charged... Well, I don't know where a woman can get her hair shampooed, cut/trimmed, and blown out for $5.  She did say she was new to the area, so maybe she could get the above service done for $5 where ever she moved from...Just to be clear, Bliss does not offer shampoos, haircuts, and styles for $5....  I noticed she did not mention the amount she was charged.   Could it have been she as embarrassed to admit that she thought $15 was "three times more than what it should have been." Because this reviewer posted this review under her name and because we had her phone number on file, I called and inquired about her time at Bliss.  I stated I was the owner and was making follow up calls with our new clients.  I did not  mention I had read her review but instead asked how she enjoyed her visit with us.  I gave her every opportunity to relate any unpleasant experience she might have had.  I was told that Bliss is a beautiful place and was thanked for taking her appointment on such short notice and after hours.  When asked how she like her hair cut even thought it really was only a trim, she responded "I like it, she did a good job." During our conversation, she never said anything negative about her visit at Bliss, and when I invited her to return in the future she said she would.  To be honest, she has not returned .  I wish she had given us another chance so that she could experience what Bliss is really about.  I would also like to respond to the comment about the service being done half-hearted and with no conversation.  The stylist's mother had just passed away very unexpectedly two weeks earlier.  She was still mourning her loss but trying to live as normal as possible and continue to work and support herself.  While this reviewer had no clue what was happening in our stylist personal life, I think because of the comment she made in her review for all to read, its important for you to know why our stylist was not her usual outgoing friendly self.   I am very interested in making each client feel welcome and appreciated.  I personally follow up with as many clients as possible to make sure that their time at Bliss was relaxing and that they are satisfied with their service.  I know this has been a lot to read, but I wanted to give a little more information about the above review.  I am sure I am not the only business owner that is willing to go above and beyond what is normal to make their guest happy.  If something is not what you are expecting, please let us know.  Give us the opportunity to "fix" it.  Our guest are the reason we even have a business and we understand that, without "you" we wouldn't be here.  We look forward to seeing you and making you feel "special" like the person you are!!!

Surprise, the steam room is broken down.  That sucks, but I could still do the sauna and whirlpool.  Wrong, sauna is broken too.  So all you get for your $25 is a whirlpool, and a lounge that has cartoons blasting loudly on the TV for some reason.

I am usually one to just write off a bad experience and say lesson learned but I did go back out front and talk to the girl at the desk.  She was very apologetic and said they should have told me about the steam room, and she had no idea that the sauna was broken.  She refunded my money and I left.

It has potential but this place is terrible right now.

resp.text:
Rhonda,

Thank you so much for the review. We always value everybody’s opinion and strive to always get better. Tuesdays are our half price color days with the purchase of a cut. We advertise that on all our social media sites as well as our website. We also post it on our daily calendar special that is posted to all the above sites as well. We also make sure and post that we are a teaching salon. That’s why we have different levels of stylists that you can choose from and the pricing is different for the particular level stylist. Our goal here is to build everyone to a master level stylist, but as with any job, it takes time. I am so happy that you liked your cut. And I would be more than happy to fix your color for you for free. We are also glad that you thought everyone was friendly. name: Kaylee Rogers
text: I went in to get my hair colored and they did nothing but condition it twice and then said they could not do it because my hair is “too dark”.

resp.text: Kaylee, thank you for your feedback. Unfortunately, what you described above was not what actually happened. As I tried to explain to you and your mother, you had layers of dark brown/black box color all over your head. My main goal is to always keep the integrity of our customer's hair in great condition. We could have easily blasted your hair with bleach and a high volume developer in an effort to remove the dark box color. However, that runs a much higher risk of damaging your hair. Instead, we chose to start with Redken's Pre-Art treatment. This treatment removes all types of things from the hair including, minerals, products, and some artificial color. It also helps to ensure that we get the best possible results from any coloring service as it helps to create a 'blank canvas' on the hair. We did that treatment on you twice, and then brought you back to the bowl to start with a 'soap cap' on your ends. A 'soap cap' is a mixture of bleach (lightener), shampoo and water. This allows the hair's integrity to also be maintained as it starts out much less aggressively removing color from the hair. It was during this process at the shampoo bowl that your mom inquired about pricing. We told her that all our color correction services start at $150/hour. She made the statement that you are 18 and booked the service online without knowing what correct questions to ask. She said you thought you would be able to achieve the blonde hair you wanted on a half price color day, so the total would end up being somewhere around $75. I am sorry for the misunderstanding. Going from a dark brown box color to a light blonde, while maintaining the integrity of your hair, is not a cheap process. It requires time, skill, knowledge, patience, and realistic expectations. Your mom said she would simply prefer to pay for the Pre-Art treatment and the soap cap and you would just leave 'as is' because you didn't want to pay the price for the full service. We never told you that you couldn't achieve the result you wanted. In fact, we told you that we absolutely could get you there! But it would be a process. You are not alone in this process. Anyone who has ever had dark colored hair and eventually achieved light blonde hair can empathize with you. It's not easy, and it's certainly not a 1-2 hour process. Trust me, if I could wave a magic wand and get you there I would. But it's my responsibility to you, as a customer, to do it the correct way and make sure you still have hair on top of your head by the end of it. I am sorry that because of a misunderstanding or miscommunication that it made you want to rate my business negatively on google. My customers are very important to me. I apologized over and over before you left to both of you and tried to explain this process and why it was so important that we do it the right way. I hope this helps to clear up any confusion about what happened on our end. I want you to be happy with your hair, and I want to help in any way I can. Please feel free to contact us and I will work with you on getting your hair color to where you want it to be. As I was more than willing to do at your initial appointment. Take care!

text: My desired red hair color was achieved! It turned out amazing! I just didn't know it was gonna cost $600 to achieve it. I didn't have that much on me either.  Next time I'm going to ask more questions or it should be brought up on how much it could be. I'm no stylist so I don't know the cost and steps you have to take. That's why I called ahead of time..I was told $51, depending on how much color. I think it needs to be estimated while you're explaining how you want it. Other Salons told me I was Overcharged! And it should've been $350 MAX and that is celebrity pricing.

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Erika. We're disappointed that your experience with us wasn't 100% enjoyable and that you had "sticker shock" at the end of your appointment! We coach our stylists and Guest Experience Experts up front on informing clients that we can't give completely set prices on color corrections as the service and products used usually changes throughout the time spent on the  correction. However, you should have definitely been updated and consulted THROUGHOUT the appointment to ensure you and your stylist were on the same page the whole time! We will talk to the appropriate members of our staff to ensure this doesn't happen again. We are glad you love the color - the pictures of it are absolutely gorgeous!

text: The salon is Glamorous! Clean and professional! I will return, but with more salon price educated.I wanted to be a deep red color, and it was achieved in 3 hrs. The only thing that I found upsetting after I was sooo very 😊 with the hair, was the total! $600!! Now,  the total shouldn't be a mystery while you are getting it done. It should be discussed about how much it will be when you are describing what you want to the stylist while she is evaluating your hair. And if its too high, then a different affordable approach. I'm not educated in this field, so I have no idea what steps have to be taken or how much those steps are, such as the $150/ hr. that I was charged. I was told differently on the appt. call. That was all the cash I had, barely enough to tip😒. So if the stylist want great tips, then make your clients more aware of the style price so they bring enough money.

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Erika. We're disappointed that your experience with us wasn't 100% enjoyable and that you had "sticker shock" at the end of your appointment! Fiona, thank you so much for your feedback. I’m sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with the service you received within our salon. I see that you did already book your next appointment with the same stylist but since it is within two weeks of your initial appointment, we would love for you to come in and allow us to make any changes at our cost that would make you love your hair. Please give us a call today at 256-665-3651 and ask to speak to Lauren, our manager. She will get you set up for an appointment sooner than your one scheduled in May. Thank you!

Edit: I talked to your stylist and front desk today regarding your initial appointment - I was informed that you were unable to receive your full ombré due to arriving very late to your appointment, therefore the stylist did not have enough time to do a full ombré for you. Unfortunately, When our application time is shortened due to the late arrival of the client - we have to alter the service.

name: Oneal Thomas
text: Not the best customer service, my sister came in to get her lashes done. Was promised that she wouldn't be charged for lash removal services since she only had about four or five lashes on at the time. She got there and after getting her lashes done they charged her even though they promised her before booking the appointment that she wouldn't be charged! plus her lashes didn't last long. She's not going public with this because of her high status in her company, but I'm glad people like me and her friends can express her disappointment in this company.

resp.text:
Hey Oneal. Please have your sister contact us directly. Every lash removal is charged for a lash removal. There has never been a time when our lash artists have approved not being paid for their time to remove a client’s lashes. I would like to speak with her so I can find out who misconstrued that information to her to cause such confusion as both of our Guest Experience Experts that handle scheduling, know that it is a service that always costs since it requires proper training and techniques to not compromise the client’s natural lashes.

There a multitude of factors that go into lashes not lasting long. And in this case, your sister, I’ll withhold her name too for the reasoning you stated, was informed for the beginning that she had short natural lashes - and going as long as she wanted to go could lessen the amount of time they would last. Getting them wet at all within 24 hours and proper at home protocols not being followed will also shorten the time.

All of this is explained at the appointment as well as some of it is notated on the waiver signed in the beginning of the appointment.

Again, please have your sister contact us directly so we discuss ways we can properly rectify this situation with her. Thanks!

***edited to add: I see she was already refunded a FULL refund for her full set 4 days ago. I’m not sure what else we can do to rectify this situation more than we have. I would still like to hear from her though who originally told her there would be no charge. Thank you

We always stand behind our work when proper at home maintenance is followed as well as when the take home products that are recommended at every new lash appointment are being used. name: Savie S
text: Normally I would rate this place 5 stars but I feel like I was majorly ripped off earlier this week on an IPL facial. Let me explain, I’ve been coming into this place to get full-face IPL treatments done for about a year. I’ve had three total treatments done in the span of a year. The first two treatments cost me $150. The second time I came in my specialist informed me that the prices will raise to $200 per IPL session. No problem for me, well... I came in earlier this week to get only CHEEKS and CHIN done and she charged me $350$!!! NO ONE informed me it would be that high! Last time I came in I was told $200. $350 for a partial face treatment is absolutely insane price. I’ve been getting these treatments done all over the country and I’ve NEVER had anyone charge me that much for a partial face IPL. Honestly, she should have told me before the treatment that it would be that much! I’ve seen her three times. I didn’t want to make a big deal about it by the time she charged me because I didn’t want to cause a scene but I’m honestly very unhappy with the lack of communication from this business. And what a shame because I really liked this place. ):

resp.text: Hi Savie. We informed you at your last IPL appointment there was a price increase expected. Prior to your next appointment, a year or so later, we left 2 voicemails to be sure you were prepared for the new pricing. I do hope you can find happiness & safe and effective IPL treatments within your budget range somewhere else.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!  I went to Skin Rx in Madison because the doctor I usually use was going to be out after having surgery.  The girl at the front desk was terribly rude!  Very unprofessional.  Even went as far as to ask me HOW I got an appointment with them...she was the one who made the appointment when I called!!   I was charged $420.00
For Botox and since receiving,  four days later, there are absolutely ZERO signs that I ever got Botox!!!
I have been doing Botox for 10 years...when my regular doctor does it, I see the results the next day!!!
Again...don’t waste your money here!  One star is too much!!

As with every client who enters our doors, I did try my best to be warm, welcoming and make you feel comfortable. I'm so sorry you did not feel the same and I wish you all the best in your aesthetic pursuits. Botox may take 7 to 10 days to be fully effective.

name: Jada Jones
text:
I’m posting this on behalf of my friend who I took to Lavish as of July 27, 2020. She went in for eyebrow waxing, natural eyelash extension and eyebrow tinting. In the photo that’s been posted you can clearly see how uneven her brows are. It’s ridiculous that you pay this much money and you receive these types of results. I will never go back to this place. If you’re reading this please take this as a warning not to go to this place and spend your money. She wasted $50 dollars for her poor service.

Update: The woman who did the job called my friend and asked us why I gave them a poor review. She said she could’ve easily fixed it. You were the one doing her eyebrows. If you would’ve looked at your work you would’ve seen the job that you did was sloppy. You didn’t care. The only reason that you care now is because you have a recent bad review. If you could’ve easily fixed it, it should’ve been done before we left and paid.

text: I’ve been going here for a while now to have my eyebrows threaded. I’ve always had really good experiences until today. Nobody here ever tried to do anything more than clean up my eyebrows, and they always looked tidy and great. But today, half of each eyebrow was threaded off it seems like. My eyebrows have never been as thin as they are now, and I’ve been having my brows done for around 10 or so years. I just hope they grow back and SOON. And the next time they need cleaning up, I’ll be finding somewhere else to have that done.

name: Maria Reagin
text:
Although the ladies were friendly enough at least one them from start to finish not so much on the lash lady near the end. Reason for one star...

The services I asked for and what I actually received in turn was not good at all. I went in for a facial threading, wax, and lash extensions yet when I went home and looked at the work done via my closeup magnifying mirror I saw lots of hair still on my face and many missed hairs on my mustache area despite being plucked as well, so attention to detail definitely royally lacking in this area.
Now, the service on my lashes was actually even worse. I went in with a picture of what style and length of lashes I was wanting and instead I left with the complete opposite as the so-called technician had admitted that she decided to go a couple of sizes up on length despite what I had requested, as well, she had missed some areas where there were gaps and so I asked for those areas to be filled and lashes trimmed since they were too long (not what I asked for), although she claimed she fixed them, NOT, I was treated with frustration and impatience after the touch up I asked for to the point that she left me in the room and didn't come back to check on me or say anything, she just went out and took another customer which clearly expressed to me that she was done with me despite the fact that she didn't do what I had asked for but instead what she wanted to do. And, after looking closer at them when I got home thru my magnifying mirror they looked horrid as all the glue was visible (not black glue) and stuck to many of the lashes which caused them to clump together and they were still too long. I really tried to deal with them, followed all the instructions (that by the way I was told upon leaving to take a picture of from their taped sheet on a mirror, really!), the best that I could but the length of them was just not natural looking to my face and the horrid clumped up lashes was just to much to deal with, SO, so disappointing.  It was even obvious by every one's look on their face when they saw me and some clearly said so. I finally had to have them carefully removed the next week. I WILL NEVER EVER, EVER RETURN TO THIS PLACE NOR WOULD I EVER RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE I KNOW, and I am not one to give bad reviews but in this case there was just too much of the bad to go around, just shameful! ☹😞😣😟...

name: N A
text: Quite possibly the worst nail place experience I have ever had. I have not gone to a single place on Highway 280 that has made me pay more than $35 for a full set WITH gel polish. The man that did my nails put so much acrylic on top of them that they looked like acrylic blobs by the end of it, at first I thought he was going to shape them, thin my nails out, but then he slapped some oil on my hands and said OK thanks. Never said a word to me the entire time, was extremely rude, and when I asked that he please thin my nails out, he grumpily got up and went and got the machine to do so. The owner (I’m guessing) walked up and asked him what he was doing, he told her, and she told him to go tend to someone else. He threw down the machine and threw up his hands and stomped off. While she did a great job at fixing my nails, she seemed just as angry as he was at having to fix them, and only said something to me, and got in a chipper mood once I handed her a five dollar bill as a tip. At the counter she handed me my receipt without telling me the price, and it was $55 total. I looked up and said “$55 for a full set?“ As I had called before going in, and was told over the phone that it would be $35. She grabbed a sign that was hidden behind the counter and pointed to where it said $55 for a full set with gel polish. I paid and left, and as if trying to make things better, she gave me stamp card where if I go so many times I get a free service or money off or something. You can bet I threw that away & will absolutely not be going back or recommending this nail place to ANYONE.

name: TheMagicOf “TheMagicOfTheFace” TheFace
text:
I am a long time customer and friend of the owner after going to them for so long. Their entire staff treated my mother like royalty and it was a special occasion each time we went. This salon is spotless and high end all the way. They create the experience you want when you are pampering yourself. The owners are exceptionally kind and welcoming to all of their customers. I have been coming here since they opened 5 years and I have recommend them to everyone since my first experience.

I find the review left below mine to be rather convoluted and contrary in content. The salon provides a list of the services offered, a polish removal would not be in the Pedicure menu on their selection chart and would not include a cuticle cut (Which Alabama does not allow) or foot scrub. If a pedicure was chosen from the menu and those services were not provided and nothing was said at the time of service, then waiting to post a negative review after paying for services you didn't get, is cowardice and absurd.

To state that a 50% tip was left on top of services you didn't even obtain, well that is just plain silly. I find it hard to believe that this is even a valid review but instead is a charge at the salon in backhanded fashion.

If services are not to your liking at the time of delivery, that is on YOU for not speaking up, and not up to the salon to have to try to disprove your statement. Did you give them the opportunity to correct their errors?

I wasn't there and can't speak for the experience but I find it odd of a self stated industry worker would go to another salon, accept a "lack of service and kindness" and wait to walk out and post a negative response online instead of "adulting" and asking for the services expected. That would have been the proper way to handle perceived poor service, to speak with the owners and give them the opportunity to make it right. The owners of THIS salon ALWAYS MAKE IT RIGHT.

text: Service was pretty good but the prices were a little more expensive than what I usually get. This day, I got the gel manicure (no nail tip) with spa pedicure. They took their time but still completed my nails in a decent amount of time and they did a fantastic job.

name: lena hoang
text: My nail tech was very nice and sweet. So that prevented me from giving them a one star. They serve complimentary wine which was good. My friend got their polish removed and a massage but they charged him for a full pedicure. No cuticle cut or scrubbing the bottom of his feet. Just polish remove and massage. The front desk guy was rude. Our services was $110 we left a $50 tip. So money wasn’t the issue. We know our nail techs worked hard but the owner ripped us off. Should’ve charged us for what we got. And my polish on my toes were not properly polished and they tried using a (used) pumice on my feet, I requested them to get a new one. I do nails and that is not sanitary at all. We will not be coming back.

name: Sarah Roberts
text: I've been going here for a couple of years and I have not been disappointed. Today I had an SNS manicure done by Franklin and it is amazing! He is an SNS master!

name: Courtney O'Dell
text: This is the best nail salon I have ever been to in the 20 years I have been getting my nails done. The owners are extremely nice, generous and appreciative of their clientele. The establishment is always very clean and if you are a frequent customer you will definitely be recognized and spoken to by multiple staff members. The S nail spa has a very large variety of services to choose from. There are at least 8 different kinds of pedicures. All are extremely relaxing. They do nails, feet, waxing, micro dermabrasion, and facials. Very few nail salons I have seen, do all of these services successfully. The quality of work you receive is beyond measure. I love Thi the most because she is so detail oriented. She is always attending classes and seminars to update the techniques they use, the polish they offer and the methods they use to do nails. I have seen a few comments on pricing here. They do not have the most competitive prices however, you pay for what you get. I never walk away from this salon dissatisfied. I never feel like it is not clean or like I am not being treated properly. I am not offered low services here. If you want competitive pricing then you probably want a low-grade salon and not one of this magnitude. The salon is extremely upscale and is ran by very honest individuals. I would give S Nail Spa 10 stars if possible!!! I am more than willing to spend a few extra dollars on services that I know will be done properly and in a clean and welcoming environment.

resp.text: I so sorry let me know, i hope can see you i will fix your nails make you happy,thank you.
